intro: Scleranthus holubyi, commonly known as the Holubý's thornweed, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Scleranthus holubyi is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging ecological conditions.
